title: Teaching Methodology for Molecular and Cellular Mechanisms: Language-Science Integrated Design Based on the MACH Model

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic biology and physiology, teaching experience, and ability to interpret and write scientific texts
context.additional_context: Strengthening instructional design competencies for pre-service/in-service teachers to explain molecular and cellular mechanisms: emphasizing linguistic transformation of scientific concepts and educational material development (textual/visual resources).

learning_goals: Cultivating scientific inquiry skills and linguistic expression by systematically explaining complex biological phenomena using the four components of the MACH model (Method-Analogy-Context-Process).

Learners must convert five core abstract concepts in biology (e.g., evolution, cell theory, ecosystem interactions) into graduate-level teaching strategies (visual analogies, real-world examples, step-by-step explanations) suitable for learners over 40, develop one syllabus and three sample instructional materials (including text-based explanations), and ensure that the materials meet at least four out of five peer evaluation rubric criteria (80%+).
Developing effective mechanism explanation methods using mobile-friendly mini-cases and visual tools: Emphasizing integrated text-image representation strategies.
Collaborative learning to iteratively improve instructional designs based on peer teacher feedback: Applying feedback text analysis and linguistic refinement techniques.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
